input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

samplesheet.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the raw reads with the prefix (read accession) to be used.
samplesheet.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the raw reads running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with a minimum of 3 columns (study_accession, reads_accession, fastq_1), and a header row. The following fields are optional or depend on the data type: fastq_2, library_layout, library_strategy, assembler.

private_study.description: To use if the ENA study is private, *this feature ony works on EBI infrastructure at the moment*

reference_genomes_folder.description: The folder with the reference genomes.

contaminant_reference.description: Filename of the reference genome located in <reference_genomes_folder> to be used for host decontamination

human_reference.description: Filename of the human genome reference located in <reference_genomes_folder> to be used for human decontamination

phix_reference.description: Filename of the PhiX genome reference located in <reference_genomes_folder> to be used for decontamination of Illumina reads

diamond_db.description: Path to diamond db (e.g. NCBI-nr) to perform frameshift correction

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

multiqc_title.description: MultiQC report title. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

input_metadata_options.title: Input metadata options
input_metadata_options.description: Custom-define metadata to select which branch of the the pipeline will be executed. This might be needed if ENA samples have been registered under the wrong metadata, or if a specific execution is required for samples.

single_end.description: Force the single_end value for the study / reads

library_strategy.description: Force the library_strategy value for the study / reads

library_layout.description: Force the library_layout value for the study / reads

platform.description: Force the instrument_platform value for the study / reads

assembly_tools_options.title: Input metadata options
assembly_tools_options.description: Specify parameters and tool versions to fine-tune the execution.

assembler.description: The short or long reads assembler

assembly_memory.description: Default memory allocated for the assembly process.

spades_only_assembler.description: Run SPAdes/metaSPAdes without the error correction step.

reads_qc.title: Reads QC options
reads_qc.description: Set the thresholds for the reads QC/filtering steps. Short reads that fail relative QC steps won't be assembled.
reads_qc.help_text: Use these options to define the quality control thresholds for your reads. You can specify the maximum allowed filtering ratio and the minimum acceptable read count. If the filtering ratio exceeds the set limit or the read count falls below the threshold, the reads will be flagged and excluded from further assembly. The information about those runs that failed are aggregated in the qc_failed_runs.csv file.

short_reads_filter_ratio_threshold.description: The maximum fraction of reads that are allowed to be filtered out. If exceeded, it flags excessive filtering. The default value is 0.1, meaning that if less than 10% of the reads are retained after filtering, the threshold is considered exceeded, and the run is not assembled.

short_reads_low_reads_count_threshold.description: The minimum number of reads required after filtering. If below, it flags a low read count and the run is not assembled.

long_reads_min_read_length.description: Minimum read length for pre-assembly quality filtering

long_reads_pacbio_quality_threshold.description: The Q20 threshold that a pacbio sample needs to exceed to be labelled as HiFi.

assembly_qc.title: Assembly QC options
assembly_qc.description: Set the thresholds for the assembly QC/filtering steps. Assemblies failing these steps won't be published.
assembly_qc.help_text: Use these options to define the quality control thresholds for your assebmlies.

short_reads_min_contig_length.description: Minimum contig length filter for short reads.

short_reads_min_contig_length_metat.description: Minimum contig length filter for short reads metaT.

short_reads_contig_threshold.description: Minimum number of contigs in human+phiX+host cleaned assembly.

min_qcov.description: Minimum query coverage threshold (0.0-1.0). Specifies the minimum fraction of the contig sequence that must align to the reference genome for the contig to be classifed as contamination.

min_pid.description: Minimum percent identity threshold (0.0-1.0). Specifies the minimum sequence similarity between the contig and reference genome alignment required to classify the contig as contamination.

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_spades_retries.description: Maximum number of task attempt retries for (meta)spades assembly steps only.
max_spades_retries.help_text: Each retry will increase the memory by 50%. Use to limit how many times this increase-and-retry happens.

max_megahit_retries.description: Maximum number of task attempt retries for megahit assembly steps only.
max_megahit_retries.help_text: Each retry will increase the memory by 50%. Use to limit how many times this increase-and-retry happens.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

max_multiqc_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching MultiQC reports to summary emails.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

hook_url.description: Incoming hook URL for messaging service
hook_url.help_text: Incoming hook URL for messaging service. Currently, MS Teams and Slack are supported.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

multiqc_logo.description: Custom logo file to supply to MultiQC. File name must also be set in the MultiQC config file

multiqc_methods_description.description: Custom MultiQC yaml file containing HTML including a methods description.
